023import java.nio.charset.*;

041/**
042 * Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of {@link BeanContext}.
043 *
044 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
045 *    <li class='info'>Typically session objects are not thread safe nor reusable.  However, bean sessions do not maintain any state and
046 *       thus can be safely cached and reused.
047 * </ul>
048 *
049 * <ul class='seealso'>
050
051 * </ul>
052 */
053@SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
054public class BeanSession extends ContextSession {
055
056   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
057   // Static
058   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
059
060   private static Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger(BeanSession.class.getName());
061
062   /**
063    * Creates a builder of this object.
064    *
065    * @param ctx The context creating this builder.
066    * @return A new builder.
067    */
068   public static Builder create(BeanContext ctx) {
069      return new Builder(ctx);
070   }
071
072   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
073   // Builder
074   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
075
076   /**
077    * Builder class.
078    */
079   @FluentSetters
080   public static class Builder extends ContextSession.Builder {
081
082      BeanContext ctx;
083      TimeZone timeZone;
084      Locale locale;
085      MediaType mediaType;
086
087      /**
088       * Constructor
089       *
090       * @param ctx The context creating this session.
091       */
092      protected Builder(BeanContext ctx) {
093         super(ctx);
094         this.ctx = ctx;
095         timeZone = ctx.timeZone;
096         locale = ctx.locale;
097         mediaType = ctx.mediaType;
098      }
099
100      /**
101       * Build the object.
102       *
103       * @return The built object.
104       */
105      @Override
106      public BeanSession build() {
107         return new BeanSession(this);
108      }
109
110      /**
111       * The session locale.
112       *
113       * <p>
114       * Specifies the default locale for serializer and parser sessions.
115       *
116       * <p>
117       * If not specified, defaults to {@link BeanContext.Builder#locale(Locale)}.
118       *
119       * <ul class='seealso'>
120       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#locale()}
121       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#locale(Locale)}
122       * </ul>
123       *
124       * @param value
125       *    The new value for this property.
126       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then the locale defined on the context is used.
127       * @return This object.
128       */
129      @FluentSetter
130      public Builder locale(Locale value) {
131         if (value != null)
132            locale = value;
133         return this;
134      }
135
136      /**
137       * Same as {@link #locale(Locale)} but doesn't overwrite the value if it is already set.
138       *
139       * @param value
140       *    The new value for this property.
141       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then the locale defined on the context is used.
142       * @return This object.
143       */
144      @FluentSetter
145      public Builder localeDefault(Locale value) {
146         if (value != null && locale == null)
147            locale = value;
148         return this;
149      }
150
151      /**
152       * The session media type.
153       *
154       * <p>
155       * Specifies the default media type value for serializer and parser sessions.
156       *
157       * <p>
158       * If not specified, defaults to {@link BeanContext.Builder#mediaType(MediaType)}.
159       *
160       * <ul class='seealso'>
161       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#mediaType()}
162       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#mediaType(MediaType)}
163       * </ul>
164       *
165       * @param value
166       *    The new value for this property.
167       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
168       * @return This object.
169       */
170      @FluentSetter
171      public Builder mediaType(MediaType value) {
172         if (value != null)
173            mediaType = value;
174         return this;
175      }
176
177      /**
178       * Same as {@link #mediaType(MediaType)} but doesn't overwrite the value if it is already set.
179       *
180       * @param value
181       *    The new value for this property.
182       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then the locale defined on the context is used.
183       * @return This object.
184       */
185      @FluentSetter
186      public Builder mediaTypeDefault(MediaType value) {
187         if (value != null && mediaType == null)
188            mediaType = value;
189         return this;
190      }
191
192      /**
193       * The session timezone.
194       *
195       * <p>
196       * Specifies the default timezone for serializer and parser sessions.
197       *
198       * <p>
199       * If not specified, defaults to {@link BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)}.
200       *
201       * <ul class='seealso'>
202       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#timeZone()}
203       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)}
204       * </ul>
205       *
206       * @param value
207       *    The new value for this property.
208       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
209       * @return This object.
210       */
211      @FluentSetter
212      public Builder timeZone(TimeZone value) {
213         if (value != null)
214            timeZone = value;
215         return this;
216      }
217
218      /**
219       * Same as {@link #timeZone(TimeZone)} but doesn't overwrite the value if it is already set.
220       *
221       * @param value
222       *    The new value for this property.
223       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then the locale defined on the context is used.
224       * @return This object.
225       */
226      @FluentSetter
227      public Builder timeZoneDefault(TimeZone value) {
228         if (value != null && timeZone == null)
229            timeZone = value;
230         return this;
231      }
232
233      // <FluentSetters>
234
235      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
236      public <T> Builder apply(Class<T> type, Consumer<T> apply) {
237         super.apply(type, apply);
238         return this;
239      }
240
241      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
242      public Builder debug(Boolean value) {
243         super.debug(value);
244         return this;
245      }
246
247      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
248      public Builder properties(Map<String,Object> value) {
249         super.properties(value);
250         return this;
251      }
252
253      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
254      public Builder property(String key, Object value) {
255         super.property(key, value);
256         return this;
257      }
258
259      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
260      public Builder unmodifiable() {
261         super.unmodifiable();
262         return this;
263      }
264
265      // </FluentSetters>
266   }
267
268   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
269   // Instance
270   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
271
272   private final BeanContext ctx;
273   private final Locale locale;
274   private final TimeZone timeZone;
275   private final MediaType mediaType;
276
277   /**
278    * Constructor.
279    *
280    * @param builder The builder for this object.
281    */
282   protected BeanSession(Builder builder) {
283      super(builder);
284      ctx = builder.ctx;
285      locale = builder.locale;
286      timeZone = builder.timeZone;
287      mediaType = builder.mediaType;
288   }
289
290   /**
291    * Converts the specified value to the specified class type.
292    *
293    * <p>
294    * See {@link #convertToType(Object, ClassMeta)} for the list of valid conversions.
295    *
296    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
297    * @param value The value to convert.
298    * @param type The class type to convert the value to.
299    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
300    * @return The converted value.
301    */
302   public final <T> T convertToType(Object value, Class<T> type) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
303      // Shortcut for most common case.
304      if (value != null && value.getClass() == type)
305         return (T)value;
306      return convertToMemberType(null, value, getClassMeta(type));
307   }
308
309   /**
310    * Same as {@link #convertToType(Object, Class)}, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must
311    * be instantiated within another class instance.
312    *
313    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
314    * @param outer
315    *    If class is a member class, this is the instance of the containing class.
316    *    Should be <jk>null</jk> if not a member class.
317    * @param value The value to convert.
318    * @param type The class type to convert the value to.
319    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
320    * @return The converted value.
321    */
322   public final <T> T convertToMemberType(Object outer, Object value, Class<T> type) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
323      return convertToMemberType(outer, value, getClassMeta(type));
324   }
325
326   /**
327    * Casts the specified value into the specified type.
328    *
329    * <p>
330    * If the value isn't an instance of the specified type, then converts the value if possible.
331    *
332    * <p>
333    * The following conversions are valid:
334    * <table class='styled'>
335    *    <tr><th>Convert to type</th><th>Valid input value types</th><th>Notes</th></tr>
336    *    <tr>
337    *       <td>
338    *          A class that is the normal type of a registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
339    *       </td>
340    *       <td>
341    *          A value whose class matches the transformed type of that registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
342    *       </td>
343    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
344    *    </tr>
345    *    <tr>
346    *       <td>
347    *          A class that is the transformed type of a registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
348    *       </td>
349    *       <td>
350    *          A value whose class matches the normal type of that registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
351    *       </td>
352    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
353    *    </tr>
354    *    <tr>
355    *       <td>
356    *          {@code Number} (e.g. {@code Integer}, {@code Short}, {@code Float},...)
357    *          <br><code>Number.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code> (e.g. <code>Integer.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code>,
358    *          <code>Short.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code>, <code>Float.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code>,...)
359    *       </td>
360    *       <td>
361    *          {@code Number}, {@code String}, <jk>null</jk>
362    *       </td>
363    *       <td>
364    *          For primitive {@code TYPES}, <jk>null</jk> returns the JVM default value for that type.
365    *       </td>
366    *    </tr>
367    *    <tr>
368    *       <td>
369    *          {@code Map} (e.g. {@code Map}, {@code HashMap}, {@code TreeMap}, {@code JsonMap})
370    *       </td>
371    *       <td>
372    *          {@code Map}
373    *       </td>
374    *       <td>
375    *          If {@code Map} is not constructible, an {@code JsonMap} is created.
376    *       </td>
377    *    </tr>
378    *    <tr>
379    *       <td>
380    *       {@code Collection} (e.g. {@code List}, {@code LinkedList}, {@code HashSet}, {@code JsonList})
381    *       </td>
382    *       <td>
383    *          {@code Collection<Object>}
384    *          <br>{@code Object[]}
385    *       </td>
386    *       <td>
387    *          If {@code Collection} is not constructible, an {@code JsonList} is created.
388    *       </td>
389    *    </tr>
390    *    <tr>
391    *       <td>
392    *          {@code X[]} (array of any type X)
393    *       </td>
394    *       <td>
395    *          {@code List<X>}
396    *       </td>
397    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
398    *    </tr>
399    *    <tr>
400    *       <td>
401    *          {@code X[][]} (multi-dimensional arrays)
402    *       </td>
403    *       <td>
404    *          {@code List<List<X>>}
405    *          <br>{@code List<X[]>}
406    *          <br>{@code List[]<X>}
407    *       </td>
408    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
409    *    </tr>
410    *    <tr>
411    *       <td>
412    *          {@code Enum}
413    *       </td>
414    *       <td>
415    *          {@code String}
416    *       </td>
417    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
418    *    </tr>
419    *    <tr>
420    *       <td>
421    *          Bean
422    *       </td>
423    *       <td>
424    *          {@code Map}
425    *       </td>
426    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
427    *    </tr>
428    *    <tr>
429    *       <td>
430    *          {@code String}
431    *       </td>
432    *       <td>
433    *          Anything
434    *       </td>
435    *       <td>
436    *          Arrays are converted to JSON arrays
437    *       </td>
438    *    </tr>
439    *    <tr>
440    *       <td>
441    *          Anything with one of the following methods:
442    *          <br><code><jk>public static</jk> T fromString(String)</code>
443    *          <br><code><jk>public static</jk> T valueOf(String)</code>
444    *          <br><code><jk>public</jk> T(String)</code>
445    *       </td>
446    *       <td>
447    *          <c>String</c>
448    *       </td>
449    *       <td>
450    *          <br>
451    *       </td>
452    *    </tr>
453    * </table>
454    *
455    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
456    * @param value The value to be converted.
457    * @param type The target object type.
458    * @return The converted type.
459    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
460    */
461   public final <T> T convertToType(Object value, ClassMeta<T> type) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
462      return convertToMemberType(null, value, type);
463   }
464
465   /**
466    * Same as {@link #convertToType(Object, Class)}, but allows for complex data types consisting of collections or maps.
467    *
468    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
469    * @param value The value to be converted.
470    * @param type The target object type.
471    * @param args The target object parameter types.
472    * @return The converted type.
473    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
474    */
475   public final <T> T convertToType(Object value, Type type, Type...args) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
476      return (T)convertToMemberType(null, value, getClassMeta(type, args));
477   }
478
479   /**
480    * Same as {@link #convertToType(Object, ClassMeta)}, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must
481    * be instantiated within another class instance.
482    *
483    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
484    * @param outer
485    *    If class is a member class, this is the instance of the containing class.
486    *    Should be <jk>null</jk> if not a member class.
487    * @param value The value to convert.
488    * @param to The class type to convert the value to.
489    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
490    * @return The converted value.
491    */
492   protected final <T> T convertToMemberType(Object outer, Object value, ClassMeta<T> to) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
493      if (to == null)
494         to = (ClassMeta<T>)object();
495
496      try {
497         // Handle the case of a null value.
498         if (value == null) {
499
500            // If it's a primitive, then use the converters to get the default value for the primitive type.
501            if (to.isPrimitive())
502               return to.getPrimitiveDefault();
503
504            // Otherwise, just return null.
505            return to.isOptional() ? (T)to.getOptionalDefault() : null;
506         }
507
508         if (to.isOptional() && (! (value instanceof Optional)))
509            return (T) optional(convertToMemberType(outer, value, to.getElementType()));
510
511         Class<T> tc = to.getInnerClass();
512
513         // If no conversion needed, then just return the value.
514         // Don't include maps or collections, because child elements may need conversion.
515         if (tc.isInstance(value))
516            if (! ((to.isMap() && to.getValueType().isNotObject()) || ((to.isCollection() || to.isOptional()) && to.getElementType().isNotObject())))
517               return (T)value;
518
519         ObjectSwap swap = to.getSwap(this);
520         if (swap != null) {
521            ClassInfo nc = swap.getNormalClass(), fc = swap.getSwapClass();
522            if (nc.isParentOf(tc) && fc.isParentOf(value.getClass()))
523               return (T)swap.unswap(this, value, to);
524            ClassMeta fcm = getClassMeta(fc.inner());
525            if (fcm.isNumber() && value instanceof Number) {
526               value = convertToMemberType(null, value, fc.inner());
527               return (T)swap.unswap(this, value, to);
528            }
529         }
530
531         ClassMeta<?> from = getClassMetaForObject(value);
532         swap = from.getSwap(this);
533         if (swap != null) {
534            ClassInfo nc = swap.getNormalClass(), fc = swap.getSwapClass();
535            if (nc.isParentOf(from.getInnerClass()) && fc.isParentOf(tc))
536               return (T)swap.swap(this, value);
537         }
538
539         if (to.isPrimitive()) {
540            if (to.isNumber()) {
541               if (from.isNumber()) {
542                  Number n = (Number)value;
543                  if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
544                     return (T)Integer.valueOf(n.intValue());
545                  if (tc == Short.TYPE)
546                     return (T)Short.valueOf(n.shortValue());
547                  if (tc == Long.TYPE)
548                     return (T)Long.valueOf(n.longValue());
549                  if (tc == Float.TYPE)
550                     return (T)Float.valueOf(n.floatValue());
551                  if (tc == Double.TYPE)
552                     return (T)Double.valueOf(n.doubleValue());
553                  if (tc == Byte.TYPE)
554                     return (T)Byte.valueOf(n.byteValue());
555               } else if (from.isBoolean()) {
556                  Boolean b = (Boolean)value;
557                  if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
558                     return (T)(Integer.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0));
559                  if (tc == Short.TYPE)
560                     return (T)(Short.valueOf(b ? (short)1 : 0));
561                  if (tc == Long.TYPE)
562                     return (T)(Long.valueOf(b ? 1l : 0));
563                  if (tc == Float.TYPE)
564                     return (T)(Float.valueOf(b ? 1f : 0));
565                  if (tc == Double.TYPE)
566                     return (T)(Double.valueOf(b ? 1d : 0));
567                  if (tc == Byte.TYPE)
568                     return (T)(Byte.valueOf(b ? (byte)1 : 0));
569               } else if (isNullOrEmpty(value)) {
570                  return (T)to.info.getPrimitiveDefault();
571               } else {
572                  String s = value.toString();
573                  int multiplier = (tc == Integer.TYPE || tc == Short.TYPE || tc == Long.TYPE) ? getMultiplier(s) : 1;
574                  if (multiplier != 1) {
575                     s = s.substring(0, s.length()-1).trim();
576                     Long l = Long.valueOf(s) * multiplier;
577                     if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
578                        return (T)Integer.valueOf(l.intValue());
579                     if (tc == Short.TYPE)
580                        return (T)Short.valueOf(l.shortValue());
581                     if (tc == Long.TYPE)
582                        return (T)Long.valueOf(l.longValue());
583                  } else {
584                     if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
585                        return (T)Integer.valueOf(s);
586                     if (tc == Short.TYPE)
587                        return (T)Short.valueOf(s);
588                     if (tc == Long.TYPE)
589                        return (T)Long.valueOf(s);
590                     if (tc == Float.TYPE)
591                        return (T)new Float(s);
592                     if (tc == Double.TYPE)
593                        return (T)new Double(s);
594                     if (tc == Byte.TYPE)
595                        return (T)Byte.valueOf(s);
596                  }
597               }
598            } else if (to.isChar()) {
599               if (isNullOrEmpty(value))
600                  return (T)to.info.getPrimitiveDefault();
601               return (T)parseCharacter(value);
602            } else if (to.isBoolean()) {
603               if (from.isNumber()) {
604                  int i = ((Number)value).intValue();
605                  return (T)(i == 0 ? Boolean.FALSE : Boolean.TRUE);
606               } else if (isNullOrEmpty(value)) {
607                  return (T)to.info.getPrimitiveDefault();
608               } else {
609                  return (T)Boolean.valueOf(value.toString());
610               }
611            }
612         }
613
614         if (to.isNumber()) {
615            if (from.isNumber()) {
616               Number n = (Number)value;
617               if (tc == Integer.class)
618                  return (T)Integer.valueOf(n.intValue());
619               if (tc == Short.class)
620                  return (T)Short.valueOf(n.shortValue());
621               if (tc == Long.class)
622                  return (T)Long.valueOf(n.longValue());
623               if (tc == Float.class)
624                  return (T)Float.valueOf(n.floatValue());
625               if (tc == Double.class)
626                  return (T)Double.valueOf(n.doubleValue());
627               if (tc == Byte.class)
628                  return (T)Byte.valueOf(n.byteValue());
629               if (tc == AtomicInteger.class)
630                  return (T)new AtomicInteger(n.intValue());
631               if (tc == AtomicLong.class)
632                  return (T)new AtomicLong(n.intValue());
633            } else if (from.isBoolean()) {
634               Boolean b = (Boolean)value;
635               if (tc == Integer.class)
636                  return (T)Integer.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0);
637               if (tc == Short.class)
638                  return (T)Short.valueOf(b ? (short)1 : 0);
639               if (tc == Long.class)
640                  return (T)Long.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0);
641               if (tc == Float.class)
642                  return (T)Float.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0);
643               if (tc == Double.class)
644                  return (T)Double.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0);
645               if (tc == Byte.class)
646                  return (T)Byte.valueOf(b ? (byte)1 : 0);
647               if (tc == AtomicInteger.class)
648                  return (T)new AtomicInteger(b ? 1 : 0);
649               if (tc == AtomicLong.class)
650                  return (T)new AtomicLong(b ? 1 : 0);
651            } else if (isNullOrEmpty(value)) {
652               return null;
653            } else if (! hasMutater(from, to)) {
654               String s = value.toString();
655
656               int multiplier = (tc == Integer.class || tc == Short.class || tc == Long.class) ? getMultiplier(s) : 1;
657               if (multiplier != 1) {
658                  s = s.substring(0, s.length()-1).trim();
659                  Long l = Long.valueOf(s) * multiplier;
660                  if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
661                     return (T)Integer.valueOf(l.intValue());
662                  if (tc == Short.TYPE)
663                     return (T)Short.valueOf(l.shortValue());
664                  if (tc == Long.TYPE)
665                     return (T)Long.valueOf(l.longValue());
666               } else {
667                  if (tc == Integer.class)
668                     return (T)Integer.valueOf(s);
669                  if (tc == Short.class)
670                     return (T)Short.valueOf(s);
671                  if (tc == Long.class)
672                     return (T)Long.valueOf(s);
673                  if (tc == Float.class)
674                     return (T)new Float(s);
675                  if (tc == Double.class)
676                     return (T)new Double(s);
677                  if (tc == Byte.class)
678                     return (T)Byte.valueOf(s);
679                  if (tc == AtomicInteger.class)
680                     return (T)new AtomicInteger(Integer.valueOf(s));
681                  if (tc == AtomicLong.class)
682                     return (T)new AtomicLong(Long.valueOf(s));
683                  if (tc == Number.class)
684                     return (T)StringUtils.parseNumber(s, Number.class);
685               }
686            }
687         }
688
689         if (to.isChar()) {
690            if (isNullOrEmpty(value))
691               return null;
692            String s = value.toString();
693            if (s.length() == 1)
694               return (T)Character.valueOf(s.charAt(0));
695         }
696
697         if (to.isByteArray()) {
698            if (from.isInputStream())
699               return (T)readBytes((InputStream)value);
700            if (from.isReader())
701               return (T)read((Reader)value).getBytes();
702            if (to.hasMutaterFrom(from))
703               return to.mutateFrom(value);
704            if (from.hasMutaterTo(to))
705               return from.mutateTo(value, to);
706            return (T) value.toString().getBytes(Charset.forName("UTF-8"));
707         }
708
709         // Handle setting of array properties
710         if (to.isArray()) {
711            if (from.isCollection())
712               return (T)toArray(to, (Collection)value);
713            else if (from.isArray())
714               return (T)toArray(to, alist((Object[])value));
715            else if (startsWith(value.toString(), '['))
716               return (T)toArray(to, JsonList.ofJson(value.toString()).setBeanSession(this));
717            else if (to.hasMutaterFrom(from))
718               return to.mutateFrom(value);
719            else if (from.hasMutaterTo(to))
720               return from.mutateTo(value, to);
721            else
722               return (T)toArray(to, new JsonList((Object[])StringUtils.split(value.toString())).setBeanSession(this));
723         }
724
725         // Target type is some sort of Map that needs to be converted.
726         if (to.isMap()) {
727            try {
728               if (from.isMap()) {
729                  Map m = to.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Map)to.newInstance(outer) : newGenericMap(to);
730                  ClassMeta keyType = to.getKeyType(), valueType = to.getValueType();
731                  ((Map<?,?>)value).forEach((k,v) -> {
732                     Object k2 = k;
733                     if (keyType.isNotObject()) {
734                        if (keyType.isString() && k.getClass() != Class.class)
735                           k2 = k.toString();
736                        else
737                           k2 = convertToMemberType(m, k, keyType);
738                     }
739                     Object v2 = v;
740                     if (valueType.isNotObject())
741                        v2 = convertToMemberType(m, v, valueType);
742                     m.put(k2, v2);
743                  });
744                  return (T)m;
745               } else if (!to.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer)) {
746                  JsonMap m = JsonMap.ofJson(value.toString());
747                  m.setBeanSession(this);
748                  return convertToMemberType(outer, m, to);
749               }
750            } catch (Exception e) {
751               throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value.getClass(), to, e);
752            }
753         }
754
755         // Target type is some sort of Collection
756         if (to.isCollection()) {
757            try {
758               Collection l = to.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Collection)to.newInstance(outer) : to.isSet() ? set() : new JsonList(this);
759               ClassMeta elementType = to.getElementType();
760
761               if (from.isArray()) {
762                  for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++) {
763                     Object o = Array.get(value, i);
764                     l.add(elementType.isObject() ? o : convertToMemberType(l, o, elementType));
765                  }
766               }
767               else if (from.isCollection())
768                  ((Collection)value).forEach(x -> l.add(elementType.isObject() ? x : convertToMemberType(l, x, elementType)));
769               else if (from.isMap())
770                  l.add(elementType.isObject() ? value : convertToMemberType(l, value, elementType));
771               else if (isNullOrEmpty(value))
772                  return null;
773               else if (from.isString()) {
774                  String s = value.toString();
775                  if (isJsonArray(s, false)) {
776                     JsonList l2 = JsonList.ofJson(s);
777                     l2.setBeanSession(this);
778                     l2.forEach(x -> l.add(elementType.isObject() ? x : convertToMemberType(l, x, elementType)));
779                  } else {
780                     throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value.getClass(), to, null);
781                  }
782               }
783               else
784                  throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value.getClass(), to, null);
785               return (T)l;
786            } catch (InvalidDataConversionException e) {
787               throw e;
788            } catch (Exception e) {
789               throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value.getClass(), to, e);
790            }
791         }
792
793         if (to.isEnum()) {
794            return to.newInstanceFromString(outer, value.toString());
795         }
796
797         if (to.isString()) {
798            if (from.isByteArray()) {
799               return (T) new String((byte[])value);
800            } else if (from.isMapOrBean() || from.isCollectionOrArrayOrOptional()) {
801               WriterSerializer ws = ctx.getBeanToStringSerializer();
802               if (ws != null)
803                  return (T)ws.serialize(value);
804            } else if (from.isClass()) {
805               return (T)((Class<?>)value).getName();
806            }
807            return (T)value.toString();
808         }
809
810         if (to.isCharSequence()) {
811            Class<?> c = value.getClass();
812            if (c.isArray()) {
813               if (c.getComponentType().isPrimitive()) {
814                  JsonList l = new JsonList(this);
815                  int size = Array.getLength(value);
816                  for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)
817                     l.add(Array.get(value, i));
818                  value = l;
819               }
820               value = new JsonList((Object[])value).setBeanSession(this);
821            }
822
823            return to.newInstanceFromString(outer, value.toString());
824         }
825
826         if (to.isBoolean()) {
827            if (from.isNumber())
828               return (T)(Boolean.valueOf(((Number)value).intValue() != 0));
829            if (isNullOrEmpty(value))
830               return null;
831            if (! hasMutater(from, to))
832               return (T)Boolean.valueOf(value.toString());
833         }
834
835         // It's a bean being initialized with a Map
836         if (to.isBean() && value instanceof Map) {
837            BuilderSwap<T,Object> builder = (BuilderSwap<T,Object>)to.getBuilderSwap(this);
838
839            if (value instanceof JsonMap && builder == null) {
840               JsonMap m2 = (JsonMap)value;
841               String typeName = m2.getString(getBeanTypePropertyName(to));
842               if (typeName != null) {
843                  ClassMeta cm = to.getBeanRegistry().getClassMeta(typeName);
844                  if (cm != null && to.info.isParentOf(cm.innerClass))
845                     return (T)m2.cast(cm);
846               }
847            }
848            if (builder != null) {
849               BeanMap m = toBeanMap(builder.create(this, to));
850               m.load((Map<?,?>) value);
851               return builder.build(this, m.getBean(), to);
852            }
853            return newBeanMap(tc).load((Map<?,?>) value).getBean();
854         }
855
856         if (to.isInputStream()) {
857            if (from.isByteArray()) {
858               byte[] b = (byte[])value;
859               return (T) new ByteArrayInputStream(b, 0, b.length);
860            }
861            byte[] b = value.toString().getBytes();
862            return (T)new ByteArrayInputStream(b, 0, b.length);
863         }
864
865         if (to.isReader()) {
866            if (from.isByteArray()) {
867               byte[] b = (byte[])value;
868               return (T) new StringReader(new String(b));
869            }
870            return (T)new StringReader(value.toString());
871         }
872
873         if (to.isCalendar()) {
874            if (from.isCalendar()) {
875               Calendar c = (Calendar)value;
876               if (value instanceof GregorianCalendar) {
877                  GregorianCalendar c2 = new GregorianCalendar(c.getTimeZone());
878                  c2.setTime(c.getTime());
879                  return (T)c2;
880               }
881            }
882            if (from.isDate()) {
883               Date d = (Date)value;
884               if (value instanceof GregorianCalendar) {
885                  GregorianCalendar c2 = new GregorianCalendar(TimeZone.getDefault());
886                  c2.setTime(d);
887                  return (T)c2;
888               }
889            }
890            return (T)DatatypeConverter.parseDateTime(DateUtils.toValidISO8601DT(value.toString()));
891         }
892
893         if (to.isDate() && to.getInnerClass() == Date.class) {
894            if (from.isCalendar())
895               return (T)((Calendar)value).getTime();
896            return (T)DatatypeConverter.parseDateTime(DateUtils.toValidISO8601DT(value.toString())).getTime();
897         }
898
899         if (to.hasMutaterFrom(from))
900            return to.mutateFrom(value);
901
902         if (from.hasMutaterTo(to))
903            return from.mutateTo(value, to);
904
905         if (to.isBean())
906            return newBeanMap(to.getInnerClass()).load(value.toString()).getBean();
907
908         if (to.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer))
909            return to.newInstanceFromString(outer, value.toString());
910
911      } catch (Exception e) {
912         throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value, to, e);
913      }
914
915      throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value, to, null);
916   }
917
918   private static boolean hasMutater(ClassMeta<?> from, ClassMeta<?> to) {
919      return to.hasMutaterFrom(from) || from.hasMutaterTo(to);
920   }
921
922   private static final boolean isNullOrEmpty(Object o) {
923      return o == null || o.toString().equals("") || o.toString().equals("null");
924   }
925
926   private static int getMultiplier(String s) {
927      if (s.endsWith("G"))
928         return 1024*1024*1024;
929      if (s.endsWith("M"))
930         return 1024*1024;
931      if (s.endsWith("K"))
932         return 1024;
933      return 1;
934   }
935
936   /**
937    * Converts the contents of the specified list into an array.
938    *
939    * <p>
940    * Works on both object and primitive arrays.
941    *
942    * <p>
943    * In the case of multi-dimensional arrays, the incoming list must contain elements of type n-1 dimension.
944    * i.e. if {@code type} is <code><jk>int</jk>[][]</code> then {@code list} must have entries of type
945    * <code><jk>int</jk>[]</code>.
946    *
947    * @param type The type to convert to.  Must be an array type.
948    * @param list The contents to populate the array with.
949    * @return A new object or primitive array.
950    */
951   protected final Object toArray(ClassMeta<?> type, Collection<?> list) {
952      if (list == null)
953         return null;
954      ClassMeta<?> componentType = type.isArgs() ? object() : type.getElementType();
955      Object array = Array.newInstance(componentType.getInnerClass(), list.size());
956      IntValue i = IntValue.create();
957      list.forEach(x -> {
958         Object x2 = x;
959         if (! type.getInnerClass().isInstance(x)) {
960            if (componentType.isArray() && x instanceof Collection)
961               x2 = toArray(componentType, (Collection<?>)x);
962            else if (x == null && componentType.isPrimitive())
963               x2 = componentType.getPrimitiveDefault();
964            else
965               x2 = convertToType(x, componentType);
966         }
967         try {
968            Array.set(array, i.getAndIncrement(), x2);
969         } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
970            throw e;
971         }
972      });
973      return array;
974   }
975
976   /**
977    * Wraps an object inside a {@link BeanMap} object (a modifiable {@link Map}).
978    *
979    * <p>
980    * If object is not a true bean, then throws a {@link BeanRuntimeException} with an explanation of why it's not a
981    * bean.
982    *
983    * <p>
984    * If object is already a {@link BeanMap}, simply returns the same object.
985    *
986    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
987    * <p class='bjava'>
988    *    <jc>// Construct a bean map around a bean instance</jc>
989    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toBeanMap(<jk>new</jk> Person());
990    * </p>
991    *
992    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
993    * @param o The object to wrap in a map interface.  Must not be null.
994    * @return The wrapped object.
995    */
996   public final <T> BeanMap<T> toBeanMap(T o) {
997      if (o instanceof BeanMap)
998         return (BeanMap<T>)o;
999      return this.toBeanMap(o, (Class<T>)o.getClass());
1000   }
1001
1002   /**
1003    * Wraps an object inside a {@link BeanMap} object (a modifiable {@link Map}).
1004    *
1005    * <p>
1006    * Same as {@link #toBeanMap(Object)} but allows you to specify a property namer instance.
1007    *
1008    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1009    * <p class='bjava'>
1010    *    <jc>// Construct a bean map around a bean instance</jc>
1011    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toBeanMap(<jk>new</jk> Person(), PropertyNamerDLC.<jsf>INSTANCE</jsf>);
1012    * </p>
1013    *
1014    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
1015    * @param o The object to wrap in a map interface.  Must not be null.
1016    * @param propertyNamer The property namer to use.
1017    * @return The wrapped object.
1018    */
1019   public final <T> BeanMap<T> toBeanMap(T o, PropertyNamer propertyNamer) {
1020      return this.toBeanMap(o, (Class<T>)o.getClass());
1021   }
1022
1023   /**
1024    * Determines whether the specified object matches the requirements on this context of being a bean.
1025    *
1026    * @param o The object being tested.
1027    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is considered a bean.
1028    */
1029   public final boolean isBean(Object o) {
1030      if (o == null)
1031         return false;
1032      return isBean(o.getClass());
1033   }
1034
1035   /**
1036    * Determines whether the specified class matches the requirements on this context of being a bean.
1037    *
1038    * @param c The class being tested.
1039    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified class is considered a bean.
1040    */
1041   public final boolean isBean(Class<?> c) {
1042      return getBeanMeta(c) != null;
1043   }
1044
1045   /**
1046    * Wraps an object inside a {@link BeanMap} object (i.e.: a modifiable {@link Map}) defined as a bean for one of its
1047    * class, a super class, or an implemented interface.
1048    *
1049    * <p>
1050    * If object is not a true bean, throws a {@link BeanRuntimeException} with an explanation of why it's not a bean.
1051    *
1052    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1053    * <p class='bjava'>
1054    *    <jc>// Construct a bean map for new bean using only properties defined in a superclass</jc>
1055    *    BeanMap&lt;MySubBean&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toBeanMap(<jk>new</jk> MySubBean(), MySuperBean.<jk>class</jk>);
1056    *
1057    *    <jc>// Construct a bean map for new bean using only properties defined in an interface</jc>
1058    *    BeanMap&lt;MySubBean&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toBeanMap(<jk>new</jk> MySubBean(), MySuperInterface.<jk>class</jk>);
1059    * </p>
1060    *
1061    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
1062    * @param o The object to wrap in a bean interface.  Must not be null.
1063    * @param c The superclass to narrow the bean properties to.  Must not be null.
1064    * @return The bean representation, or <jk>null</jk> if the object is not a true bean.
1065    * @throws NullPointerException If either parameter is null.
1066    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the specified object is not an an instance of the specified class.
1067    * @throws
1068    *    BeanRuntimeException If specified object is not a bean according to the bean rules specified in this context
1069    * class.
1070    */
1071   public final <T> BeanMap<T> toBeanMap(T o, Class<? super T> c) throws BeanRuntimeException {
1072      assertArgNotNull("o", o);
1073      assertArgNotNull("c", c);
1074      assertArg(c.isInstance(o), "The specified object is not an instance of the specified class.  class=''{0}'', objectClass=''{1}'', object=''{2}''", className(c), className(o), 0);
1075
1076      ClassMeta cm = getClassMeta(c);
1077
1078      BeanMeta m = cm.getBeanMeta();
1079      if (m == null)
1080         throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Class is not a bean.  Reason=''{0}''", cm.getNotABeanReason());
1081      return new BeanMap<>(this, o, m);
1082   }
1083
1084   /**
1085    * Creates a new {@link BeanMap} object (a modifiable {@link Map}) of the given class with uninitialized
1086    * property values.
1087    *
1088    * <p>
1089    * If object is not a true bean, then throws a {@link BeanRuntimeException} with an explanation of why it's not a
1090    * bean.
1091    *
1092    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1093    * <p class='bjava'>
1094    *    <jc>// Construct a new bean map wrapped around a new Person object</jc>
1095    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.newBeanMap(Person.<jk>class</jk>);
1096    * </p>
1097    *
1098    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
1099    * @param c The name of the class to create a new instance of.
1100    * @return A new instance of the class.
1101    */
1102   public final <T> BeanMap<T> newBeanMap(Class<T> c) {
1103      return newBeanMap(null, c);
1104   }
1105
1106   /**
1107    * Same as {@link #newBeanMap(Class)}, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must be instantiated
1108    * within another class instance.
1109    *
1110    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
1111    * @param c The name of the class to create a new instance of.
1112    * @param outer
1113    *    If class is a member class, this is the instance of the containing class.
1114    *    Should be <jk>null</jk> if not a member class.
1115    * @return A new instance of the class.
1116    */
1117   public final <T> BeanMap<T> newBeanMap(Object outer, Class<T> c) {
1118      BeanMeta m = getBeanMeta(c);
1119      if (m == null)
1120         return null;
1121      T bean = null;
1122      if (m.constructorArgs.length == 0)
1123         bean = newBean(outer, c);
1124      return new BeanMap<>(this, bean, m);
1125   }
1126
1127   /**
1128    * Creates a new empty bean of the specified type, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must
1129    * be instantiated within another class instance.
1130    *
1131    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1132    * <p class='bjava'>
1133    *    <jc>// Construct a new instance of the specified bean class</jc>
1134    *    Person <jv>person</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.newBean(Person.<jk>class</jk>);
1135    * </p>
1136    *
1137    * @param <T> The class type of the bean being created.
1138    * @param c The class type of the bean being created.
1139    * @return A new bean object.
1140    * @throws BeanRuntimeException If the specified class is not a valid bean.
1141    */
1142   public final <T> T newBean(Class<T> c) throws BeanRuntimeException {
1143      return newBean(null, c);
1144   }
1145
1146   /**
1147    * Same as {@link #newBean(Class)}, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must be instantiated
1148    * within another class instance.
1149    *
1150    * @param <T> The class type of the bean being created.
1151    * @param c The class type of the bean being created.
1152    * @param outer
1153    *    If class is a member class, this is the instance of the containing class.
1154    *    Should be <jk>null</jk> if not a member class.
1155    * @return A new bean object.
1156    * @throws BeanRuntimeException If the specified class is not a valid bean.
1157    */
1158   public final <T> T newBean(Object outer, Class<T> c) throws BeanRuntimeException {
1159      ClassMeta<T> cm = getClassMeta(c);
1160      BeanMeta m = cm.getBeanMeta();
1161      if (m == null)
1162         return null;
1163      try {
1164         T o = (T)m.newBean(outer);
1165         if (o == null)
1166            throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Class does not have a no-arg constructor.");
1167         return o;
1168      } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
1169         throw e;
1170      } catch (Exception e) {
1171         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
1172      }
1173   }
1174
1175   /**
1176    * Returns the {@link BeanMeta} class for the specified class.
1177    *
1178    * @param <T> The class type to get the meta-data on.
1179    * @param c The class to get the meta-data on.
1180    * @return
1181    *    The {@link BeanMeta} for the specified class, or <jk>null</jk> if the class
1182    *    is not a bean per the settings on this context.
1183    */
1184   public final <T> BeanMeta<T> getBeanMeta(Class<T> c) {
1185      if (c == null)
1186         return null;
1187      return getClassMeta(c).getBeanMeta();
1188   }
1189
1190   /**
1191    * Returns a {@code ClassMeta} wrapper around a {@link Class} object.
1192    *
1193    * @param <T> The class type being wrapped.
1194    * @param c The class being wrapped.
1195    * @return The class meta object containing information about the class.
1196    */
1197   public final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Class<T> c) {
1198      return ctx.getClassMeta(c);
1199   }
1200
1201   /**
1202    * Used to resolve <c>ClassMetas</c> of type <c>Collection</c> and <c>Map</c> that have
1203    * <c>ClassMeta</c> values that themselves could be collections or maps.
1204    *
1205    * <p>
1206    * <c>Collection</c> meta objects are assumed to be followed by zero or one meta objects indicating the
1207    * element type.
1208    *
1209    * <p>
1210    * <c>Map</c> meta objects are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value
1211    * types.
1212    *
1213    * <p>
1214    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
1215    *
1216    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
1217    * <ul>
1218    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A normal type.
1219    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(List.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A list containing objects.
1220    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(List.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A list containing strings.
1221    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A linked-list containing
1222    *       strings.
1223    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> -
1224    *       A linked-list containing linked-lists of strings.
1225    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(Map.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A map containing object keys/values.
1226    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(Map.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A map
1227    *       containing string keys/values.
1228    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(Map.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);</code> -
1229    *       A map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.
1230    * </ul>
1231    *
1232    * @param <T>
1233    *    The class to resolve.
1234    * @param type
1235    *    The class to resolve.
1236    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
1237    * @param args
1238    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
1239    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
1240    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
1241    * @return The class meta.
1242    */
1243   public final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Type type, Type...args) {
1244      return ctx.getClassMeta(type, args);
1245   }
1246
1247   /**
1248    * Given an array of {@link Type} objects, returns a {@link ClassMeta} representing those arguments.
1249    *
1250    * <p>
1251    * Constructs a new meta on each call.
1252    *
1253    * @param classes The array of classes to get class metas for.
1254    * @return The args {@link ClassMeta} object corresponding to the classes.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1255    */
1256   protected final ClassMeta<Object[]> getArgsClassMeta(Type[] classes) {
1257      assertArgNotNull("classes", classes);
1258      ClassMeta[] cm = new ClassMeta<?>[classes.length];
1259      for (int i = 0; i < classes.length; i++)
1260         cm[i] = getClassMeta(classes[i]);
1261      return new ClassMeta(cm);
1262   }
1263
1264   /**
1265    * Shortcut for calling {@code getClassMeta(o.getClass())}.
1266    *
1267    * @param <T> The class of the object being passed in.
1268    * @param o The class to find the class type for.
1269    * @return The ClassMeta object, or <jk>null</jk> if {@code o} is <jk>null</jk>.
1270    */
1271   public final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMetaForObject(T o) {
1272      return (ClassMeta<T>)getClassMetaForObject(o, null);
1273   }
1274
1275   /**
1276    * Shortcut for calling {@code getClassMeta(o.getClass())} but returns a default value if object is <jk>null</jk>.
1277    *
1278    * @param o The class to find the class type for.
1279    * @param def The default {@link ClassMeta} if the object is null.
1280    * @return The ClassMeta object, or the default value if {@code o} is <jk>null</jk>.
1281    */
1282   protected final ClassMeta<?> getClassMetaForObject(Object o, ClassMeta<?> def) {
1283      if (o == null)
1284         return def;
1285      return getClassMeta(o.getClass());
1286   }
1287
1288   /**
1289    * Locale.
1290    *
1291    * <p>
1292    * The locale is determined in the following order:
1293    * <ol>
1294    *    <li><c>locale</c> parameter passed in through constructor.
1295    *    <li>{@link BeanContext.Builder#locale(Locale)} setting on bean context.
1296    *    <li>Locale returned by {@link Locale#getDefault()}.
1297    * </ol>
1298    *
1299    * @see BeanContext.Builder#locale(Locale)
1300    * @return The session locale.
1301    */
1302   public Locale getLocale() {
1303      return locale;
1304   }
1305
1306   /**
1307    * Media type.
1308    *
1309    * <p>
1310    * For example, <js>"application/json"</js>.
1311    *
1312    * @see BeanContext.Builder#mediaType(MediaType)
1313    * @return The media type for this session, or <jk>null</jk> if not specified.
1314    */
1315   public final MediaType getMediaType() {
1316      return mediaType;
1317   }
1318
1319   /**
1320    * Returns the type property name as defined by {@link BeanContext.Builder#typePropertyName(String)}.
1321    *
1322    * @param cm
1323    *    The class meta of the type we're trying to resolve the type name for.
1324    *    Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1325    * @return The type property name.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1326    */
1327   public final String getBeanTypePropertyName(ClassMeta cm) {
1328      String s = cm == null ? null : cm.getBeanTypePropertyName();
1329      return s == null ? getBeanTypePropertyName() : s;
1330   }
1331
1332   /**
1333    * Returns the name property name.
1334    *
1335    * <p>
1336    * Currently this always returns <js>"_name"</js>.
1337    *
1338    * @return The name property name.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1339    */
1340   public final String getNamePropertyName() {
1341      return "_name";
1342   }
1343
1344   /**
1345    * Returns the bean registry defined in this bean context defined by {@link BeanContext.Builder#beanDictionary(Class...)}.
1346    *
1347    * @return The bean registry defined in this bean context.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1348    */
1349   public final BeanRegistry getBeanRegistry() {
1350      return ctx.getBeanRegistry();
1351   }
1352
1353   /**
1354    * Returns a reusable {@link ClassMeta} representation for the class <c>Object</c>.
1355    *
1356    * <p>
1357    * This <c>ClassMeta</c> is often used to represent "any object type" when an object type is not known.
1358    *
1359    * <p>
1360    * This method is identical to calling <code>getClassMeta(Object.<jk>class</jk>)</code> but uses a cached copy to
1361    * avoid a hashmap lookup.
1362    *
1363    * @return The {@link ClassMeta} object associated with the <c>Object</c> class.
1364    */
1365   public final ClassMeta<Object> object() {
1366      return ctx.object();
1367   }
1368
1369   /**
1370    * Returns a reusable {@link ClassMeta} representation for the class <c>String</c>.
1371    *
1372    * <p>
1373    * This <c>ClassMeta</c> is often used to represent key types in maps.
1374    *
1375    * <p>
1376    * This method is identical to calling <code>getClassMeta(String.<jk>class</jk>)</code> but uses a cached copy to
1377    * avoid a hashmap lookup.
1378    *
1379    * @return The {@link ClassMeta} object associated with the <c>String</c> class.
1380    */
1381   public final ClassMeta<String> string() {
1382      return ctx.string();
1383   }
1384
1385   /**
1386    * Returns a reusable {@link ClassMeta} representation for the class <c>Class</c>.
1387    *
1388    * <p>
1389    * This <c>ClassMeta</c> is often used to represent key types in maps.
1390    *
1391    * <p>
1392    * This method is identical to calling <code>getClassMeta(Class.<jk>class</jk>)</code> but uses a cached copy to
1393    * avoid a hashmap lookup.
1394    *
1395    * @return The {@link ClassMeta} object associated with the <c>String</c> class.
1396    */
1397   public final ClassMeta<Class> _class() {
1398      return ctx._class();
1399   }
1400
1401   /**
1402    * Creates either an {@link JsonMap} or {@link LinkedHashMap} depending on whether the key type is
1403    * String or something else.
1404    *
1405    * @param mapMeta The metadata of the map to create.
1406    * @return A new map.
1407    */
1408   protected Map newGenericMap(ClassMeta mapMeta) {
1409      ClassMeta<?> k = mapMeta.getKeyType();
1410      return (k == null || k.isString()) ? new JsonMap(this) : map();
1411   }
1412
1413   /**
1414    * Logs a warning message.
1415    *
1416    * @param msg The warning message.
1417    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
1418    */
1419   @Override
1420   public void addWarning(String msg, Object... args) {
1421      if (isDebug())
1422         LOG.log(Level.WARNING, ()->args.length == 0 ? msg : MessageFormat.format(msg, args));
1423      super.addWarning(msg, args);
1424   }

1498   /**
1499    * Beans require no-arg constructors.
1500    *
1501    * @see BeanContext.Builder#beansRequireDefaultConstructor()
1502    * @return
1503    *    <jk>true</jk> if a Java class must implement a default no-arg constructor to be considered a bean.
1504    *    <br>Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the {@link Object#toString()} method.
1505    */
1506   public final boolean isBeansRequireDefaultConstructor() {
1507      return ctx.isBeansRequireDefaultConstructor();
1508   }
1509
1510   /**
1511    * Beans require Serializable interface.
1512    *
1513    * @see BeanContext.Builder#beansRequireSerializable()
1514    * @return
1515    *    <jk>true</jk> if a Java class must implement the {@link Serializable} interface to be considered a bean.
1516    *    <br>Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the {@link Object#toString()} method.
1517    */
1518   public final boolean isBeansRequireSerializable() {
1519      return ctx.isBeansRequireSerializable();
1520   }
1521
1522   /**
1523    * Beans require setters for getters.
1524    *
1525    * @see BeanContext.Builder#beansRequireSettersForGetters()
1526    * @return
1527    *    <jk>true</jk> if only getters that have equivalent setters will be considered as properties on a bean.
1528    *    <br>Otherwise, they are ignored.
1529    */
1530   public final boolean isBeansRequireSettersForGetters() {
1531      return ctx.isBeansRequireSettersForGetters();
1532   }
1533
1534   /**
1535    * Beans require at least one property.
1536    *
1537    * @see BeanContext.Builder#disableBeansRequireSomeProperties()
1538    * @return
1539    *    <jk>true</jk> if a Java class doesn't need to contain at least 1 property to be considered a bean.
1540    *    <br>Otherwise, the bean is serialized as a string using the {@link Object#toString()} method.
1541    */
1542   public final boolean isBeansRequireSomeProperties() {
1543      return ctx.isBeansRequireSomeProperties();
1544   }

1693   /**
1694    * Time zone.
1695    *
1696    * <p>
1697    * The timezone is determined in the following order:
1698    * <ol>
1699    *    <li><c>timeZone</c> parameter passed in through constructor.
1700    *    <li>{@link BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)} setting on bean context.
1701    * </ol>
1702    *
1703    * @see BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)
1704    * @return The session timezone, or <jk>null</jk> if timezone not specified.
1705    */
1706   public final TimeZone getTimeZone() {
1707      return timeZone;
1708   }
1709
1710   /**
1711    * Time zone.
1712    *
1713    * <p>
1714    * The timezone is determined in the following order:
1715    * <ol>
1716    *    <li><c>timeZone</c> parameter passed in through constructor.
1717    *    <li>{@link BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)} setting on bean context.
1718    * </ol>
1719    *
1720    * @see BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)
1721    * @return The session timezone, or the system timezone if not specified.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1722    */
1723   public final ZoneId getTimeZoneId() {
1724      return timeZone == null ? ZoneId.systemDefault() : timeZone.toZoneId();
1725   }

1733    */
1734   public final boolean isUseEnumNames() {
1735      return ctx.isUseEnumNames();
1736   }
